reference.title: Lesson 6: Proposals and Instructions Workshop
reference.shortdesc: Lesson 6 teaches proposals and has students work with their assigned team on the instruction set workshop.

ul.li: Employ concepts and structure of proposals.
Analyze written work from assigned teammates' instruction set assignments.

strow.stentry: Proposals: Researching and writing proposals, including the structure of standard proposals and proposals based on a request for proposal (RFP)Instruction set workshop: Students review and edit their assigned teammates' instruction set assignments (requires that you first assign students into workshop groups)Because of the winter session's accelerated schedule, you should delay this workshop one lesson during the winter session, giving students one additional day to work on their papers.

p.xref: Letter of understanding for formal report (group)
p.note: The letter of understanding is the same exercise specified in Lesson 7. If you give students the option to select either report type (proposal or recommendation report), you should wait until Lesson 7 to assign it.

strow.stentry: Due in 5 lessons: Final draft of group project to research and write a formal report (proposal and/or a recommendation report)This is the same assignment specified in Lesson 7. If you give students the option to select either report type (proposal or recommendation report), you should wait until Lesson 7 to assign it.
